content.description:
Start as for The Hunger. Move slightly left before pressing to make a big reach to the right hand sidepull. To the top from there.



On the Inertia boulder in the tunnel between it and the backside of the Scarface boulder.

Pads. Spotter.

SDS matched on a sloping scoop. Make a big move across to a sloping fin around 5+ft away and go straight up from the fin or continue through the bulge. Either way does not effect the rating.

See topo
Pads
Starts on left hand sharp crimp, right hand on a small crimp around right. Climb up and right, finishing to the right of the arete.
Same start as Battle of Yavin, but continue left at the big sloper to mantle left of the arete.

Sit start in the scoop feature. Then move up and left on to the slab.

Side of the warmup boulder.
A couple pads.

Left hand on a shallow edge and right hand on a small 2 finger dimple about 2 feet to the right. Campus through a couple powerful moves to a mellow top out.

There is a low start project that would bump the grade up substantially.



Top of the talus field, next to Runaway Train.

pads
Start at the jug inside the cave hugging the corner and traverse out across the crack and up through the small opening and mantle up once out! Pads may be an issue with clearance

Start matched on jug and traverse left on thin holds to better holds on the face.

See topo
Pads

Start matched on crimp rail, moving up and left through crimpers to the top

Backside of warm up boulder
Pads and spotter

Sit start matched on good ledge. Move up and left to top out.


Twenty feet or so above Decepticon boulder. In the alcove 10' behind you when you're facing Enriched Plutonium.

Pads

SDS with left hand on a small divot on the arete, right hand on side pull.

Near the top of the talus behind The Three Amigas
1 pad

SDS from thin edges and finish up and right. 
  
 Project: Same start but head out right on face using some very thin edges.

About 20m past the pullout on the flats
Pad

SDS matched on a thin diagonal rail. Fire up and left to a thin edge and then bump up to the lip. Finish up and right. Deceptively hard for the grade. 

See topo
Pads

Traverse right to left on the juggy lip and turn the corner to head up to the peak.

Topo coming soon
Pads

Straddle the short prow with the left hand up and left on a small edge and the right down on a shallow 3 finger divot. Go for the jug and mantle to the left using the fin.

See topo
Pad

Starting on the sloping lip about 3m right of Statutory Crank, make moves along the lip up and to the left. Top out as for Statutory Crank. Along the faint trail between The Power that Preserves and Toxic Avenger. Pads.
Spotter.

Start with hands matched on a big ledge on the right side of Furiously Happy.

Behind the 3 amigas.
1 pad if you can fit it

Just above the underclings you will find a sharp incut sidepull and a small edge a few inches higher. Go for the lip.

See topo
Pad

Climbs The Power that Preserves but continue past the rail to a juggy edge and finish directly up from there. 
  
 There are two open projects on this boulder. The first is just to the right of Evolution of Power - start with the left on the juggy edge and the right on positive edge. Throw for the lip. The second would link Evolution of Power into the previous project.

Scarface Boulder. See topo.
Pad

Sit start with right hand on a side pull pinch, and left hand on a small crimp. Paste feet and go up. One mover. 



Just to the right of He-man.

Seater pads.

SDS on some smooth edges at the back of the small cave. Work your way out to a sloping exit. 
  
 Rating has not been confirmed.

Atomic Energy Boulder
Pads

Start matched on flake on left side. Move up to gaston, then move feet up and get radical. Positive holds up top.

Back side of Eastern Promises boulder.
Pads.

SDS in the middle of the rock on edges then go straight up on decent holds. 



Up and behind Eastern Promises boulder. 

Pad.

Start on the sloper rail at head height, go straight up.



On the pac-man boulder directly oposite atomic

Start on opposing slopers, throw for right hand crimp and make your way to the top.  Awesome compression.

Directly behind the warm up boulder
A pad or two

Start low on the arete and climb to a good hold which will allow you to traverse into Moment of Inertia. Tough start with a hard finish.

Inertia Boulder. See topo.
Pads

Start left on the corner, right where ever feels right. Paste the feet sand enjoy the slab above. Tricky landing.



Directly above the atomic boulder.

Lots of pads, or the ability not to fall.

Start from two knobs on the rail and finish as for Quinn's Problem.

Scarface Boulder. See topo.
Pad

Start as for Knobular and finish as for Nate's Problem.

Scarface Boulder. See topo.
Pad

Start matched on the left rail and move right and up.

Left of Suspended Animation on Inertia boulder
One Pad

On the same boulder as Urban Scrawler, Massive Attack and Chemical Brothers. Start on a left crimp and a small right side pull BELOW the starting jug of the other climbs. Climb straight into that, then go straight up using a heinous pinch and some sharp crimps out left. Avoids the holds of all(?) the other climbs.

SDS matched on the incut crimp in the centre of the face. Mantel and climb the easy slab to finish uncovientially on the detached block know as 'The Three Amigas.' Great fun!



Along the trail between eastern promise and atomic.

pad and spotter

Start with the left just past the fin on the lip and the right on a good edge. Throw for the top. 
  
 There is a project that starts from the edges in the middle of the face with a very big move to the lip from bad feet.

See topo.
Pad

Start matched on the jug and use pinches and slopers to climb the steep arete to better holds.

See topo
Pads

Start as for Decepticon and finish left traversing the lip around to the peak.

See topo
Pads

A great problem on the steep face of the Inertia Boulder. Start with the left hand on the jug and the right on a gaston. Reach out right to a good pinch that will set you up for the big throw to the lip and finish with a stiff mantle. 
  
 The start can be awkward for taller climbers. 
  
 There is a sit-start project from a left two finger pinch and the right low on the arete.

On the Inertia Boulder which is leaning up against the Scarface Boulder. See topo.
Pads

Start as for Quinn's Problem but make a big move up and right to a good hold. Finish straight up.

Scarface Boulder. See topo.
Pad

Start on the jug and climb to the top on nice edges.



On the atomic boulder

Start as for Knobular but eliminate the positive rail to the left and go straight up to the juggy edge. Hard for the grade.



Backside of Scarface boulder

Pads

Start right hand on a side pull and left on a crimp, do a balancy move to a jug and top out straight up. 



Right beside the parking lot.

One of the king lines of Elbow Lake. Start up the slab and climb into the fridge, use holds on the left side of that feature until you can get your hands over to the right, then commit to the sketchy mantel. Full value!



In the centre of the upper talus field, easily identifiable from the road due to its large and prominent shape.

lots of pads.
Start low on the left facing edge. A bit dabby.

Start with right side-pull and rail, go straight up.Good warm up.

On the right side of Eastern Promises Boulder
1 Pad

Start from two underclings and make a big move up to the sloping lip.

Atomic Energy Boulder
Pad

Start as for Quinn's Problem. Traverse the sloping rail to a very thin edge and finish straight up from here.

Scarface Boulder. See topo.
Pad

Start on the high sloping shelf directly above the pit, get here however necessary. A balancy start leads to a cruiser finish up the diagonal rail.



To the left of pac-man on the same boulder.

a pad for the pit

Start with the left on a smooth edge and the right on the loose inset. Make a big move to the rail, adjust, and finish slightly left on good holds.

Scarface Boulder
Pad

Start on the far right side and traverse all the way to the left and mantel. Very fun!



Go through the tunnel behind scarface, it will be on your left.

pads

Start matched on the crimp below the bulge (same as Suspension of Disbelief Low). Do the same start moves as that problem and follow the jug rail left to a dab-arific finish through the small hole! 

As far as butt draggers go this one is full value



In the surfer rosa cave.

One pad for the start, the rest protects itself

Start right hand on a side pull and left on the top of the rib, fire for the lip and work your way over the bulge.



Right beside the parking lot.

Start with left hand on a good incut at the top of the crack and right hand compressing on the lowest reasonable spot on the arete. Work your way up using some classic compression climbing mixed in with some foot sorcery. This one's full value! 



Just off the road near the trail up to scarface.

pads and spotters

Start on the far right end of the big shelf, traverse left and go through some balancy moves to reach the top!



Go up past chemical brothers to the top of the talus.

2-3 pads

Sit start with hands matched on a good ledge and go straight up to the lip. 

About twenty feet to the right of the Chemical Brothers boulder.
Pads.

Start at the far end of the shelf and work your way up the 'scar' to an okay jug. Drop off.

See topo
Pads

Start left on a good hold around the arete and right hand compressing on a positive rail on the face. Squeeze your way to the top!



When looking at The Power that Preserves it will be behind you and to the right. Can't miss it.

pads

Starting in the alcove on the lowest obvious rail, make difficult moves to gain the sloping ledge above. From here, trend up and right - exit at the junction of this and the Inertia boulder.



On the backside of the Scarface boulder, in the alcove on your right as you exit the tunnel between the Scarface and Inertia boulders. Currently very dirty.

Pads. Spotter(s).

A left to right traverse of the Decepticon Boulder. Fun problem.

Topo coming soon
Pad

SDS matched on the flake. Use some tricky foot work to reach up to the jug scoop. Finish up the middle of the face.

Topo coming soon
Pad

Put your left on the jug scoop and the right on an edge way out right. Go straight up using great features. Great problem.

See topo
Pad

SDS from an iron cross position using both aretes. Go for the jug and finish as for Slash. 
  
 Eliminate the flake to the left for a V5 or 6 start. Paste your feet onto the face and go for the jug.

See topo
Pad

Start with right hand on a juggy undercling and left on a pinch, slap up to the sloper and wrestle to the top.



Right beside the parking lot.

Starting on the left obvious fin/ledge make a bigger opening move to the wide ledge above. Press awkwardly onto the ledge. Finish straight up on good holds. Along the faint trail running between The Power That Preserves and Toxic Avenger. Pads.
Spotter.

Sit start with hands on the nose of the boulder. Use blocky holds and crimps to follow the arete up to the top.

Backside of warmup boulder.
A couple pads.

Sit start in middle of the scoop and traverse left. Then follow the arete up to the top.

Side of the warmup boulder.
A few pads.

Start on two ledges on either side of prow, make your way up the nose.

Right beside the road
1 or 2 pads

Start as for Suspension of Disbelief. Traverse right along the shelf and reach out to some smooth flat edges to set up for the crux exit moves. Finish straight up the tall slab on good holds. Very technical to mantle the slab.

Suspension boulder. Topo coming soon.
Pad

SDS matched on a thin edge under the belly and finish with Surfer Rosa. Long. 
  
 Rating has not been confirmed.

See topo
Pads

Start left hand pinching the left arete and the right on either a good but wide undercling/pinch or a small but poor undercling/pinch. Move up to the slab, slapping the sloper dish. Finish straight up with a further right crimp and  better holds for the left.

Located in the open towards the arete, left of Moment of Inertia.
Pads.

Start down in the cave on two smooth edges, paste your feet on, and throw for the fat shelf. Use some trickery to make the 4+ foot reach to a couple of small insets on the roof and continue climbing through the roof and finish up using the arete. 
  
 20+ moves in almost 30ft of climbing with almost half of that on a roof. Can't get any better than this. I have to rank this problem up there with Blade of lightning, Leviathan, and Nautilus as one of the best V10's in the Valley.

A solid SDS project will add a grade and increase it to 25+ moves. There are also 2 or 3 open projects coming out of this cave.

Suspension Boulder. Topo coming soon.
Pads and a good spot.

SDS about 8ft down and left of the original start matched on an edge under the steep bulge. A few hard moves will get you back to the original start.

Topo coming soon
Pads

Sit start to Three Amigas. 



Located on smaller boulder left of Eastern Promises.

Pads.

Start matched on a large incut about head height. Straight up

Between Toxic Avenger and Eastern Promises
Several Pads if you are not confident on V0 :-)

Start on a good juggy right hand mid face and left on side crimp around the arete. Big move to the tip and move left to exit.

First move crux in a tight space with not so great landing.

Beta video for The Tipping Point



See topo for Pac-man. If you are standing in front and looking at Pac-man. It is right behind you in a hidden hole. Below Decepticon.


few pads. uneven and tight landing.

Start with the left on the sharp lip just past the start for Atomic and the right on the lowest of the edges in the roof just above two small boulders. Work your way into a match on the Atomic fin and finish over the prow. A couple of stiff moves lead to the fin and a solid finish. 
  
 Rating has not been confirmed.

See topo
Pad

Start on the fat rail and traverse up left.

Atomic Energy Boulder
Pad

Start on the left side with hands match on a rail and move right.

Back side of Inertia boulder
Couple of Pads

Start on the Union Pigs start holds and move straight up

See Union Pigs
Couple of pads

SDS with the right on a good edge and the left on the bottom of the short diagonal rail. Go for the lip.

See Unknown
Pad

SDS from two good edges and go for the lip.

See Unknown
Pad

SDS from the obvious shelf and go straight up.

100m up the trail to the main wall.
Pad

Start as for Massive Attack and exit through the slab.

See topo
Pads

Not sure if this is a new route or a retro scrub so happy to change any info. Traverse the slab without using hands, balancing on ledges and smears.  Top out once you reach the end of the traverse, again without any hands. It's a short route but fun to practice balance and footwork.



Walk up the trail on the right, with the Elbow Lake sign.  The trail will lead into the top of the boulder field and there's a boulder that looks precariously perched (see photo.) It's on the opposite side of the boulder.

Start matched on the flat blocky portion of the lip and head up the arete.

See topo
Pad

Start on the arete with hands matched on two micro edges just above two good foot holds.

Directly across from Scarface.
Pad

Make the first 2 moves of Speedbump, but then continue traversing right, rolling over the lip when you've run out of rock to climb.  Powerful start followed by a very pumpy enduro finish.

A slightier easier version starts with hands on the bulge on the far left, eliminating the first move (V4ish).



Roadkill boulder, right next to the parking, furthest south of the boulder field.

Two or three pads

Sit start matched on the sloper rail. Paste on feet and move up and right. Top out near the peak of the boulder.


About twenty feet, up the hill and to the right of the Chemical Brothers boulder.

Pads

Sit start matched on a sharp crimper. Move right to the big ledge and go up and slightly left. Be creative and radical to reach the nice rail.

Backside of the warmup boulder.
Couple pads.

Sit start squeezed in the tunnel between The Hunger and Rahkanna boulders with both hands matched on the blocky hold. Make an awkward move to the left arête . Top out as per Arêtes R’ Us



In the tunnel between The Hunger and Rahkanna boulders.

Pads. Spotter.
Enter a description of this area.
